intro: Parnassia bifolia, commonly known as the twinleaf parnassia, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves. The plant produces white, star-shaped flowers that are often adorned with a yellowish central spot. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as bogs and woodlands. Parnassia bifolia is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
